answers.answer: The website provides information on how to manage in Iași, including details on who can offer assistance in the new city.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'IAȘI'.

answers.answer: You can contact the Iași County Immigration Service via email at is.igi@mai.gov.ro or by phone at 0232 302 315 or 0232 302 322.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: The emergency call number in Romania is 112.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: Information required for the accommodation, board, and integration support program can be found through the Directorate of Social Assistance Iași.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Iași'.

answers.answer: Public transport in Iași is not free for Ukrainians, but details about ticket costs, payment methods, and areas can be found via a provided link.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Transportation'.

answers.answer: For urgent medical services, contact the County Emergency Clinical Hospital "Sf. Spiridon" Iași, and for children, go to the Emergency Clinical Hospital for Children "Sf. Maria" Iași.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: A list of free family medicine services for refugees from Ukraine is available on the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: Psychological support is available in various languages including Ukrainian, Russian, Romanian, English, and Polish, depending on the organization.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: The International Organization for Migration (IOM) provides psychological support by referencing individuals to resources, organizing psychosocial and mental health awareness events, and offering training, workshops, and supervision.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: The multi-service center for children and adolescents offers kindergarten, school preparation, Ukrainian language school for grades 1-11, and an integration program into the Romanian education system.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: Several organizations in Iași offer free Romanian language courses, including Inspectoratul Școlar Județean Iași, Centrul de Asistență Umanitară și Socială pentru Refugiați CTR Nicolina, Crucea Roșie, and Caritas.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: The CTR Nicolina Refugee Center provides accommodation, products, food, medical assistance, psychological counseling, Romanian language courses, and organizes a kindergarten and educational activities for children.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The Romanian National Council for Refugees (CNRR) offers legal advice and information regarding asylum procedures, child protection, and integration.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: AIDRom offers support for accessing medical services, legal assistance, psychological counseling, socio-cultural and recreational activities, and reimbursements for legalized translation services.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Justiție pentru minori provides mediation services, accommodation and meals for mothers and children, legal advice including family reunification services, and support for accessing medical and other needed services.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Support is available for accessing reproductive health services, navigating the health system, and for victims of domestic violence through the Women's Center.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Women's Center'.

answers.answer: If you need HIV psycho-medical-social services in Romania, you can access them via consilierehiv.ro.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-iasi and read the section under 'Counseling for people living with HIV'.
